pull.title: ci: Minor improvements inspired by Bitcoin Core
pull.body: This steals two recent CI improvements from bitcoin/bitcoin.  See individual commit messages.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.message:
ci: Use remote pull/merge ref instead of local git merge

The merge strategy on the remote may be different than the local one.
This may cause local merges to be different or fail completely. Fix this
by using the result of the remote merge.

(copied from bitcoin/bitcoin@fad7281d7842f337932cf44e703fdd631230ddd6)

ci: Don't fetch git history

(copied from bitcoin/bitcoin@faa65f12fc137231c0333330f670847473650028)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,11 +55,11 @@ cat_logs_snippet: &CAT_LOGS
 
 merge_base_script_snippet: &MERGE_BASE
   merge_base_script:
-    - if [ "$CIRRUS_PR" = "" ]; then exit 0; fi
-    - git fetch $CIRRUS_REPO_CLONE_URL $CIRRUS_BASE_BRANCH
     - git config --global user.email "ci@ci.ci"
     - git config --global user.name "ci"
comments.body: Those lines could be [removed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/ac1d99240af6c5d3ed5db2beea1479903d949a37) as well.
